messages.message: Hi all, today I've been getting danger warnings on my github PRs (this one https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/29191) saying that a commit doesn't exist, even though I havent been rebasing my branch or anything (I just use `git merge master` to update my branch). Is anyone else having this problem? I'm not sure how to fix this
I am facing the same issue

we enabled the github action with forked pull request today, it is possible that you are getting the error because your forked repo is not synced up with the main repo (which is not required, our danger script should be able to handle that), I will look into it and fix it, please ignore it for now :pray:
mean while you can try sync your forked repo and see if that helps
hmm I did that and re-ran the job but still getting the same issue

I just disabled it on instabase repo, no need to distract people on code freeze day on such issue. Please ignore danger error like above :point_up:

this is actually an unexpected result as we were enabling it for another repo (ibformer) by request, in order to do so we had to enable it on GitHub org level and as a result GitHub turned it on for all repos under the org by default :github-fire:
